website_summaries.verdict: Although not a pro-grade tool, this reliable saw is set apart by its ability to cut metal.

customer_reviews.title: Metal Chop Saw Can't Cut Straight
customer_reviews.text: Total piece of Junk. It will not cut square for the life of it. That is why I bought it to get more accuracy in my cuts without having to purchase a coolant fed bandsaw. I already have a metal chop saw but it's miters are atrocious. This saw is such a pile of junk it is ridiculous. It cuts violently through steel but it cannot keep the cut straight so every corner has a different length and so nothing never lines up . A total waste of good money!!!!! Don't waste your pennies.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: ) I like the slow-start feature of the motor
customer_reviews.text: For the DYI projects I do, this is an incredible piece of equipment. I finally am able to make miter cuts. My 1968 Montgomery Wards PowerKraft miter box has been laid to rest :) I like the slow-start feature of the motor. I'm 69 and have that same feature myself. From what I am learning, the dust management system on many saws does a poor job, this saw is no exception. Other than that, it's probably overkill for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Day

customer_reviews.title: The saw is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: The saw works beautifully and I couldn't be happier with it. Now if I could just find a way to make the dang expensive blades last longer, I'd be thrilled. I've watched the "how to" video on how to make optimal cuts for blade longevity, but I'm not convinced that I've gotten any more 'mileage' out of the blades. I've had a few blades that went dull after the 5th cut on 20ga 2" square tubing. That really sucks. One great thing about this saw (with the single bevel capability, not the double though) is that it will work with blades that have either a 5/8" hole or a 1" hole.
customer_reviews.author: The Sib

customer_reviews.title: My first chop saw
customer_reviews.text: I don't have experience with any other brands but this one works just fine. I have a cabinet table saw, large routers, etc but always used a regular circular saw for framing. What a treat to use. I got the optional stand with extensions and rollers and it is easy to transport and setup too. Since I am not a contractor, I figured I could get by with a less expensive saw. This one feels tight (no slop) and slides smoothly so not sure how much more I would get if I got one of the higher end ones. A quicker operating hold down would be nice (one that you can set and release with a lever).
customer_reviews.author: Robert H Jenney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Metal Saw
customer_reviews.text: This tool works as advertised! Assembling a steel building and needed to cut purlens, etc. This cuts steel, wood, plastic pipe, etc with no issues and little mess , other than the usual bits. There are not the huge volume of sparks you get with an abrasive blade, you do get metal bits from the carbide blade so you do need to wear proper safety equipment. One note - this saw is has a soft-start feature, when you pull the trigger, nothing happens for a few seconds and then the saw starts. Took me a couple of pulls before I realized this.
customer_reviews.author: rapunzel

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for small shop
customer_reviews.text: Love this saw. I don't use the general purpose blade, I have an aluminum, steel, and stainless blade. I change the blade for what ever I may be cutting. It makes beautiful straight clean cuts. I even cut billet aluminum 2" thick to use on the mill.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Kloth

customer_reviews.title: Great for home projects
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for a wood working project and it performed well. I have no tested this cutting any material besides wood. Pros: Assembles Easily Arm slides smoothly Cuts well through thick pieces of wood. Cons: I find the laser on this and most power tools to be worthless. Overall it seems to be a good saw for around the house. I would not use this saw for any professional use
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Oates

customer_reviews.title: Good for cutting steel studs, design could be better with trivial improvements
customer_reviews.text: Cut steel studs really well. Leaves a lot of burrs on wood though. Great for framing when it doesn't matter. Angles are not accurate (not even 90), so you need to calibrate. Wish they didn't require hex wrenches for adjusting the side/wing holders because those will get lost. Hard to turn on/off laser if you have normalize sized fingers. Wish I could cut a 2x4 on it's side, it leaves a 1/8" uncut which I have to manually remove with hand saw.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: and the laser is useless as it moves to the right as soon as ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the replacement from the first one, due to not the same as pictured on web site. Second one is off square, and the laser is useless as it moves to the right as soon as you pull down on the saw. keeping for truck saw.
customer_reviews.author: Busy B

customer_reviews.title: Nice, solid fit and finish—well-made—good, tight adjustments
customer_reviews.text: I really like this saw. I regularly use Hitachi, but I was happy to find this as an option for cutting metal and various materials. It's accurate, has a nice, solid fit and finish—well-made—good, tight adjustments. One thing I'm a little unsure about is the laser indicator, but I didn't even expect this saw to include that, so I could care less. Good power with a soft start. Good saw. Happy I got it. Just don't expect these blades to last if you are cranking through a lot of metal...not much carbide on the teeth, but somehow seemed sufficient for the price (blade).
customer_reviews.author: IceHouse

customer_reviews.title: So far so great! I read every review before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: So far so great! I read every review before purchasing, both positive and negative and heavily lean towards positive! if your a large production metal shop than steer clear especially when you have employees with no skin in the care of your tools. For a home metal/woodshop this is an excellent value.....yeah there are some quirks with plastic parts but again it cuts metal with almost zero sparks and a clean cut that saves you time angle grinding! i have used this saw every day since the day i received last week and have probably made 100-150 cuts so far from 12 gauge to 1/4" and everytime it goes through like butter! Absolutely worth the investment!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great saw! Cut through 100 mild-steel balusters!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this miter saw because I needed to cut 100 mild-steel balusters for my house. I wanted a saw that would cut wood when I was done with the job, which is why I didn't want to purchase a Chop-saw. I was very impressed by this particular saw. The blade it came with Cutthrough 75 pieces until it started wearing down. I had to purchase another one through Amazon, but I didn't mind. The folks at evolution told me that it wasn't designed to cut through so much steel but it did a great job. Once I put the new blade on I cut through the rest like butter. I highly recommend this saw!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This saw is the bomb
customer_reviews.text: I can cut anything I want without changing blades or have 2 saws. it cuts metal and wood seamlessly (and all other stuff they list) I bought a used (refurbished item) but I have No complaints. After several hours of use, the blades look fine and still cuts metal like butter, Amazon delivered it promptly and with its original package, have no idea why it was returned before but it came to me in great shape. highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: H. Galdamez

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I've used the saw to cut 1-inch 12-16 ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've used the saw to cut 1-inch 12-16 gauge square tubing without any problems. Blade cuts like butter and I love the soft start. My only knock on the saw is that the clamping method is not as secure as a saw specifically designed as a chop saw to cut metal. Works great on wood, but you have to hold metal tubing tight to keep from moving. Good saw for a hobby welder that won't be using it every day for industrial use.
customer_reviews.author: Tex916 Houston

customer_reviews.title: Very well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built saw . I just wanted it for cutting lumber for making stands for heated cat houses for our feral cats in the winter time and other minor things around the house. So for me it's purrfect . A person who is a carpenter by trade may have a different view, but it's more than fine for what I do.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: as expected, good results.
customer_reviews.text: My first impression after cutting a few materials (plastic, alum, steel) plastic, no problems alum, also no problems, however the cut with the stock blade isn't as appealing as other cuts... however I would give it a 8.5/10 steel, there is some minor tear out. I was going at a fast feed rate, and had some minor tear out... I could have gone slower, however the end result was more than satisfactory for welding purposes... far superior to any fiber cut. I am going to buy the recommended metal blade and see how this goes. I felt the low teeth count might be contributing towards the tear out. all in all, for 200.00 ish shipped, it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: R. Cler

customer_reviews.title: This is the best sling since the compound miter saw
customer_reviews.text: This is the best sling since the compound miter saw, but this will cut steel. And no sparks great for the garage enthusiast welder like me. And what real cool if you need to cut a piece of wood because its already set up, it will do that to. The bade that it comes with will do every thing ok. Nicer blade nicer cut.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Good saw.  Needs a better base.
customer_reviews.text: It cuts metal like a regular chop saw cuts wood. But its base is way too flimsy. Dont try setting an I-beam on it like the picture on the box shows. The saw would probably cut it but the base would probably break. And they could have put some decent thumbwheel adjusters on the guide laser. Good luck trying to lock it down without moving the laser. I tried for an hour and gave up. Fortunately, the fence is perpendicular to the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Chris in Freeland

customer_reviews.title: Good shop saw, but watch the blade!
customer_reviews.text: After about a dozen cuts thru wet treated 4x4's, I was wondering why it wasn't as accurate. The blade got so hot, it was flexible. Not good. Have to let it cool down. But on a good point, the furnished blade does cut almost anything.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Slaton

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: This saw is very dangerous. After making several cuts on 1/8th” thick,1-inch angle iron, with the Evolution metal cutting blade, a four-inch piece of angle iron shot across the garage. My husband is lucky to be uninjured. When he inspected the saw he found that the aluminum fence casting had cracked. See the attached picture. It is now going in the trash. He will never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: ashma

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly pleased with this. Price was excellent for the quality, the slide is smooth and effortless, and I never realized how nice a 'spin-up' blade would be instead of the instant-on. I echo the sentiment about the proprietary size bore in the blade, so that is my only complaint... But on the whole, I'm just fine with supporting this company with future purchases.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: I like this tool
customer_reviews.text: I like this tool. It came in 3 pieces and assembly wasn't too difficult for someone like me who is not very handy. I used it for the first time last night to cut wood and PVC piping, and it was a smooth operation. If you want to use this tool for heavy projects like metal cuts I highly suggest that you buy a different blade. Customer service was awesome. They promptly responded to my email and addressed my concerns
customer_reviews.author: dexter

customer_reviews.title: BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN YOU INSPECT THE ITEM. The ...
customer_reviews.text: BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN YOU INSPECT THE ITEM. The item I received was NOT a RAGE3. RAGE3 had 2000 watt motor but the item I received 1800 watt motor. I asked for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sang Park

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised .
customer_reviews.text: So far I have cut 10 20/20 aluminum extrusions , 1/8 inch x 4 inch aluminum flat bar and 1/8 " thick 1" cold steel angle . All where great cuts , smooth and square . I did make slight adjustments to fence and o degree angle before I cut . Was slightly off not much at all out of the box .
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Fast, clean, and easy metal cutting
customer_reviews.text: I used the multi purpose blade that came with it for aluminum, biggest so far is 2 x 0.5 bar. It cuts fast, cool, and much cleaner than an abrasive wheel or even a bandsaw. Very nice edge. I bought the steel blade and used it on 0.065 wall square tube, again with great results. I had my doubts when I bought it but I have to say it does exactly what they claim. Not a pro-quality tool but well executed given the price. Very happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: PC

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old 10" Makita. A good price and the ability to cut metal is what sold me to take a chance on a tool from Great Britain. I have had it nearly 3 years and it has not disappointed me once. Has been a workhorse for light residential jobs. The metal cutting is amazing. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware: might die on you.
customer_reviews.text: Watch the video reviews, they speak for themselves. This thing is stable, reliable, cost effective, and looks pretty darn cool too! Updated Review: owned this for only a little while (used for about 30 cuts of wood.) And now it's not working. There are two magnets on the motor that have popped out and won't stay in. Pretty big disappointment considering the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe and inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Finaly figured out why it eats through metal blades like know other at $60 a pop thats pretty unacceptible. The back stop is not strait. Its angled slightly inward causing it to move the metal while cutting and catches the blades on the teeth chipping them. While catching the teeth if you dont have a good grip it will rip the metal out of your hands and throw it.
customer_reviews.author: Mason

customer_reviews.title: Great Machine!
customer_reviews.text: It does what is advertised. Less of a mess using a Disc machine. Fast cutting barely no heat. You need a face mask! Those flying chips are hot! I am able to cut 3" (Max) square steel (14ga) tube with no problem. Best investment! Almost bought a 14" Chop saw, I am happy I bought this instead! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: kenKeN

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Technically, it does cut metal. However, there is no vise. So, the metal you are cutting easily moves which damages the blade. If you primarily cut metal, I recommend purchasing a dedicated metal cutting saw instead. I would not buy again and would not recommend. It works ok as a wood cutting saw, which is why I gave it 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on wood
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on wood. Unfortunately it's terrible on metal. I started a welding cart build and after three cuts the blade started to wobble. I made one more cut clamping down the metal, this thing started to shake very bad so I ditched it and grabbed the old 4 inch grinder. I should of bought a band saw.
customer_reviews.author: Edd107

customer_reviews.title: this tool is really hit or miss. You MUST ...
customer_reviews.text: this tool is really hit or miss. You MUST clamp your work piece down as tight as possible. The sliding lock must be tightened down all the way unless actually sliding. the first steel blade I bought for this dulled out after a dozen cuts on 2x2 1/8" steel. The replacement blade chipped two teeth on the first cut! It shot my workpiece end cut so hard into the top of the saw that some of the casing broke, and bent my fence out of alignment. Amazon will not replace now I have a broken saw that won't cut straight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're going to use the saw to cut iron ...
customer_reviews.text: If you're going to use the saw to cut iron it's not worth it save your money by miter bandsaw. The blades do not last long and I really don't think it was designed to cut any type of Iron
customer_reviews.author: Paisley n Fiona

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the most awesome saw ever. As a machinist I've been using cold saws for decades but there's never been one available to the public. I'm glad I waited for a compound sliding saw.
customer_reviews.author: Les Fogerson

customer_reviews.title: Good tool for the hobbiest
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for the hobbiest. Have cut hardened steel, square tubing, bar stock. I don't think it would hold up to light commercial or industrial use. Too many plastic parts, poor hold down design. Table is light cast aluminum. Laser is very poor, hard to see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The saws great, the blade sucks
customer_reviews.text: The saws great, the blade sucks, i cut about 4 10' lengths of 3/4 16g steel and some angle aame gauge and its shot. I ordered the stainless blade today wich is BS i had to spend almost anothef 100.00. If it dont hold up guess ill just have a wood chop saw and go back to disc chop saw...
customer_reviews.author: jesse wilson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight but efficient tool!
customer_reviews.text: It’s light yet does an excellent job cutting My tubing whereas I can barely see the seam! Precise, comes to mind. The clamp is not Heavy duty, but a c clamp suffices very well. For its cost it does the job especially if you (Allow) the blade to cut.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia D.

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a let down
customer_reviews.text: I love the saw. I was disappointed that one of the clamps was missing. I hope you can send one. I also didn't get the green bolts to hold the head on. I hope someone really reads this.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this saw, it makes very nice clean cuts. I never tried using the combo blade that comes with it... I put the Evolution steel cutting blade on it right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Davis

customer_reviews.title: Nice saw - feels rigid and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This saw worked great for getting through several relatively thick steel tubes I needed to cut. I was dubious about using this for cutting steel, but it had no issues. I haven't used it extensively except for that one job, but it still works fine despite being covered with sawdust and sand particles from cutting certain items.
customer_reviews.author: RisingPhoenix

customer_reviews.title: I was unsure about buying this due to some poor reviews. They are wrong
customer_reviews.text: I have been a professional welder/fabricator for well over 18 years. I was unsure about buying this due to some poor reviews. They are wrong! This thing is amazing. Perfect for working with smaller tubing etc. My good old chop saw just wasn't accurate and the band saw is big and clumbsy. I knew first cut I made the right choice. You can even cut thin slices. I will agree the hold down clamp could use improving but it dose the job.
customer_reviews.author: jon

customer_reviews.title: This is kick
customer_reviews.text: I have over 1000 cuts thru all thicknesses over metal. 1/16" angle iron thru 1"x 2" flat stock This machine is holding up extremely well. Few screws vibrate out now and then, but works great. Finding blades that keep up is the problem.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: BOLTR: AvE would be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: It does NOT cut square that well. The sliding arm has a lot of wobble and can throw off a cut about 2 degrees in the y-axis. Also the miter stops display a bit of wobble which can throw off the cut 1 degree in the z-axis. You can adjust the fence to compensate a little but it's not a perfect fix. When cutting metal though, the wobble and play is a lot greater and is often WORSE than an abrasive saw. Overall the unit is chinesium grade and is not skookum.
customer_reviews.author: Hungry Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I do actually love this saw, made my life so much easier. Only problem, don't be cheap and get the 10" like me and wish you had the 14". Just get the 14 and you will thank me later oh and let the saw do it's job don't treat it like it's cutting an old two by four
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: China garbage that cuts surprisingly well
customer_reviews.text: The saw I received is not the one I ordered nor the one pictured on the box. It is not the new rage three it is the old version. All in all this all seems OK standard Chinese nonsense though(i.e. Peeling stickers cheap feeling parts, have to square it every time etc.). I figured it would be given the price but thought I'd give it a go. I decided to use it regardless of it being the wrong saw do to the fact that I waited way longer than I should have for Amazon prime to deliver it. I cut a few test pieces and I'm very pleased with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Randall

customer_reviews.title: Damaged in shipment.
customer_reviews.text: This may be an excellent product, but it was damaged in shipment so I didn't get it, I ended up buying a Dewalt locally because I couldn't wait any longer.
customer_reviews.author: KnitePrince

customer_reviews.title: Try and cut something round you'd better forget using them
customer_reviews.text: I'm still undecided about this saw. The hold-downs only work for a few types of metal. Try and cut something round you'd better forget using them. Even flat stuff isn't held in place very well. The laser isn't very bright so I don't use it. The blade that comes with the saw does cut metal but the cuts are not as clean as some of the videos show they are and it throws molten metal everywgere. The miter angle seemed to be correct which is nice. If I had to do it all over again, I'd buy a layover band saw.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best saw I have ever used. I have been a certified wielder for 42 year's .Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: They is the best saw then I have ever used. I had a lot of 2 inch steel tubing to cut and it did beautifully. I have cut Wood aluminum and pipe. I've used band saws for steel Wood AND their not as crisp and clean as what this will. I recommended this to friends. Would buy again. On wood it produced a finish good enough for glueing.
customer_reviews.author: James McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw. No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is awesome. Cuts through metal in seconds and very clean. Love the flexibility of different angles
customer_reviews.author: Mel Madrid

customer_reviews.title: Works very well on steel
customer_reviews.text: Works very well on cutting steel tubing, round and square. Yellow blade doesn't last real long on steel. Best to buy a steel blade if cutting only steel.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt M. Roth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing saw.
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed by this saw. Its ability to cut through metal, in the manner that it does, is astonishing. Very little heat and spark....precise cuts. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, cuts clean
customer_reviews.text: Great saw, cuts clean...motor starts slow...between trigger pull and blade spin. But hoping its just needing to get broke in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: missing important parts
customer_reviews.text: Missing clamping parts. I used this saw at a previous job I had and it was unusable without the clamps. Mine shipped missing one clamp tube and clamp.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Amazon is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the products I have purchased with amazon Prime. When and if I am not pleased with any product ordered, they have made it easy to return the items.
customer_reviews.author: Milton O.

customer_reviews.title: Trying to figure out how works.
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to align the laser but nothing and i make some cuts and what I found is that one side is smooth and the other not i don't know what to do. ..
customer_reviews.author: mel

customer_reviews.title: Cutting machine. On a budget.
customer_reviews.text: Cut, cut, cut like no time tomorrow. Everything was great and I had no issue with the machine. Worked great and was satisfy. I know its not the most expensive brand out there that you would like, but it works and does it job.
customer_reviews.author: ChauChau

customer_reviews.title: Rage3 Saw by Evolution
customer_reviews.text: This saw was recommended by a friend of mine that cuts a lot of metal trim. He said this saw is amazing and I agree. It has been stated in other reviews that the hold down clamp is not of the best quality or function which has been our experience as well. That said we have not really had any problem getting the part to be held in a stable position for cutting. I would recommend this saw!
customer_reviews.author: William Ishmael

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: Have made many cuts 2 inch x 3/16 mild steel angle and still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: john monts

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the price. Slight delay on the power trigger buts cuts very well. Be sure to wear proper clothing. The metal flakes gets all over your clothing and its hard to get it off. The clamp is a junk. I used large trigger clamps instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It went together very easy and the quality is pretty good
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this as a replacement to a DW874 as wanted to get away from the abrasive cutting discs. It went together very easy and the quality is pretty good. I decided to do one test cut and realized it was a slow start motor - that's pretty cool for something in this price range. I have not used other then that one cut yet but I am looking forward to it. The only CON I have is I wish the clamps were better made.
customer_reviews.author: Charles T Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great for the cost
customer_reviews.text: Great father day gift. I used it after fine tuning the angles. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Wiliam R Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Fine Saw
customer_reviews.text: A really fine, well designed saw for steel cutting. My only complaint is that the hot sparks from the blade have destroyed the laser, which I don’t need much anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Patron

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for rough wood work, pretty good for metals
customer_reviews.text: It cuts about anything, laser is good enough to line up an angle or rough dimension. I like the slow start motor. Not fine enough cut for tight joints, I believe that is from a slow spinning blade, but for cutting a 2x10 it works well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Justin H.

customer_reviews.title: Always a bummer when your order something and open it up to be disappointed. I could return it but it's needed on ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with missing motor brush lock ring. I spent a couple hrs coming up with a fix for this, so the saw works. Always a bummer when your order something and open it up to be disappointed. I could return it but it's needed on a project tomorrow. Fairly inexpensive saw, so you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: JH B.

customer_reviews.title: Complete piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: I made 3 cuts on thin-walled steel tubing and one piece of aluminum and now it's dead. The laser is on, but the motor won't run. I followed their troubleshooting and apparently the circuit board is done.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I recieved the saw when it was supposed to be their, and self assembling was easy. Customer support over the phone was a little useless, but all in all it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Davis

customer_reviews.title: Innovative
customer_reviews.text: I have three complaints, but I give it 4 stars for it's ability to cut steel - such an improvement over abrasive disks. Complaint one is the clamping system. Two is the slightly mushy angle locking mechanics. Three is that when you attach the head to the body (comes in two parts with a clever snap joint), make it permanent with a couple of drops of epoxy to eliminate the slight play. I'd call this construction grade. I hope they will someday give us a professional version. Also, if you are cutting a lot of metal, get their dedicated steel cutting blade for a better cutting experience. Let the saw do the cutting. That's the key to blade life here.
customer_reviews.author: David Orth

customer_reviews.title: Adjust make sure it’s angles right!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described, I installed laminate flooring with ease cuts!
customer_reviews.author: Richy

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a steel cutting saw.
customer_reviews.text: I love this saw, but replacement blades are pretty expensive. I've used it on some pretty thick stock, and as long as you don't force it the thing will get it done. Nice miter cuts. I've been using it for a couple years now, and it's still working great.
customer_reviews.author: James Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good power easy set up nice fit and finish.
customer_reviews.text: So far works as expected. Pro Has good power well built. Cons. When cutting metal the chips get flung everywhere. You need to mindful of this. The other I don't really like the delay between when you click the switch and the motor starts. I assume this has to do with how the motor speed is controlled. Seems like they could shorten that delay though.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Fortney

customer_reviews.title: Stock blade has poor performance on mild steel.
customer_reviews.text: The stock blade is not very clean when cutting mild steel. The cuts are not square, and jagged. I suggest buying the 52 tooth blade for cleaner cuts. I have both this miter saw and the larger evolution 14" cutoff saw in the shop, and really enjoying the results.

product_meta.title: Evolution Power Tools RAGE3 10-Inch Multipurpose Cutting Compound Sliding Miter Saw
product_meta.description:
The RAGE3 offers all the functionality of a normal miter saw, while cutting through materials never thought possible. This 10” sliding compound miter saw will cut steel, aluminum, plastics, and wood (even wood with nails); using just one blade. The cut is fast, clean and accurate; producing no burr and virtually no sparks when cutting steel. There is no heat buildup either, so the material is cool and can be handled straight away.

Multipurpose cutting is coupled with useful features such as an in-line handle enabling right or left handed use, adjustable cutting depth for grooving, laser guidance system and robust outer casing enhancing durability. A high torque motor and optimized gear box make this a powerful and reliable compound sliding miter saw. 

A full range of blades is also available (sold separately) to turn this saw into a sliding tile cutter and to allow for more specific metal cutting applications. The Rage 3 Sliding Compound Miter Saw, comes with Evolution’s 3 Year Limited Warranty.

Motor: 1800W (Soft Start)
Amps: 15
Horsepower: 2.5
RPM (No Load): 2500
Blade Arbor: 1 inch, with dual flange to allow for 5/8” arbor blades
Maximum Width of Cut (90 degree Miter): 11-13/16 inches
Maximum Width of Cut (45 degree Miter): 8-1/4 inches
Maximum Depth of Cut (90 degree Bevel): 3 inches
Maximum Depth of Cut (45 degree Bevel): 1-1/2 inches
feature_bullets: MULTIPURPOSE CUTTING: Patented multipurpose cutting technology allows you to make compound miter cuts in mild steel, aluminum, plastics, and wood; with the included blade.
MINIMAL SPARKS, BURRS & HEAT: Cut through 6mm mild steel with no heat, no burrs & virtually no sparks, leaving an instantly workable finish unlike alternate methods.
SIMPLE & ACCURATE MITER CUTTING: Features a 45 degree L&R miter system with 9 positive stops. A 0-45 degree bevel tilt, allows for bevel cuts and compound cuts.
SLIDING MITER CUTS: Slide mechanism allows for 90 degree cuts of up to 11-13/16 inches wide and 45 degree cuts of up to 8-1/4 inches wide. Comes with laser guidance for optimum accuracy.
ADJUSTABLE CUTTING DEPTH: Cutting depth can be adjusted to allow for grooving and trenching. 15A Powerful Hi-Torque Motor with Soft Start
TUNGSTEN CARBIDE TIPPED BLADE: Comes with an ultra high grade 28 tooth tungsten carbide tipped blade, allowing you to make miter cuts through wood, mild steel, aluminum, and more.
RELIABLE CUTTING: A high torque motor and optimized gear box make this a powerful and reliable compound sliding miter saw.
ADDITIONAL VERSATILITY: A full range of blades is available (sold separately) to turn this saw into a sliding tile cutter and to allow for more specific metal cutting applications.
